thread.title: ATP WTA Finals: Top moments ahead of year end championships - Tennis
thread.title_full: ATP WTA Finals: Top moments ahead of year end championships - Tennis - SI.com

author: James Pham
title: ATP WTA Finals: Top moments ahead of year end championships - Tennis
text:
by James Pham Posted: Mon Oct. 12, 2015 BEIJING – The joint WTA-ATP China Open wrapped up on Sunday, as No. 1 Novak Djokovic defeated Rafael Nadal to maintain his dominance in Beijing and Garbine Muguruza topped Timea Bacsinszky to claim the title. The tournament is popular among players for its proximity to the players’ hotel and among fans for its ease of access, located just a few subway stops away from the Bird’s Nest, the official national stadium. As an ATP 500 and a WTA Premier Mandatory event, the tournament traditionally enjoys strong draws on both sides and the 2015 edition saw 16 of the top 20 women and eight of the top 16 men were in the field.
In case you missed any of the action, here are the top storylines and Quote: s from a week in Beijing: The Great Wall can only get you so far
China had six players in the singles draw (two men and four women) but none would make it out of the second round. In a post-Li Na era, Chinese journalists were focused on finding the next great hometown player, especially on the men’s side where China’s top three players are already in their mid-20s and ranked outside the Top 200.
Tennis Watch List: ATP's top 20 in Shanghai; Top women play for Singapore spots by SI.com Staff
